direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return the single object but in different states (before and after the first call).
The hasNext() method determines the availability of the next element, which is directly related to the next() method's behavior.
Both methods throw IllegalStateException under similar conditions, indicating a dependency on the state of the iterator.
The reset() method reverts the iterator to its initial state, which is structurally similar to the state management in the next() method.
The set() method modifies the object returned by next(), suggesting that test cases for next() could be adapted to test set() as well.
